Reviews.Title: The most reliable laptop I've ever owned and faster but cheaper than HP, Dells and espeically ThinkPads
Reviews.Author: Anonymous "Anonymous"
Reviews.Content: The most reliable laptop I've ever owned and superbly inexpensive since Toshiba makes and sells the same laptop parts Dell and HP.The "dirty truth": about these inexpensive Satellites is the lack of discussion  these briefcase tornadoes arrive with even if you skip the RAM upgrade and the SSD.These things can masquerade as small company web and file/print servers with RAM to spare.Video game performance is slightly above average for a general purpose Toshiba versus an expensive AlienWare.Its great for college students and high schoolers and will keep up with their courseload so they can't blame an F or triple DMinus on a crappy laptop.But it gets really cool when you stuff the maximum RAM cause it's eager for Microsoft Servers including 2012 2nd Edition (tested on BETA edition for MS Gold Partners), the wide 64Bit CPU's and vast RAM carries HYperV or VBox VM's as smoothly as your campus partition slice.Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop and SoundBooth in CS5.5 run stutter free, rendering 3D objects in Ai doesn't disappoint and 16GB of RAM lets you stack more layers in PhotoShop than you're accustomed to in your current laptop.Adult students considering IT programs or considering an upgrade would be well served with a 64Bit Toshi that can handle your curriculum without being connected to campus VM's.Linux loving, all the way back to Unbuntu 10.04 that forward supports this  unit is amazing itself, oddly though the Intel and Qualcomm GB Ethernet port often needs separate compat level drivers but the modprobe instructions are straight forward even if annoying.  The WiFi cards have always seemed LINUX ready and that's contrary to what's usually finicky WiFi but ready CAT5 ports.WiFi range is strong, hard to buy a Toshi w/o an 802.11n card and big cigar width four inch copper antennas metal taped to the inner lid means decent signal strength when the rest of the audience is struggling to hold 240p on YouTube.Toshi's are fairly sturdy but the easiest to work on if you're accustomed to ThinkPads and Sony Vaio's then you'll welcome the spacious case and modular components. Anyone ready to murder the housecat in frustration after splitting a ThinkPad LCD will fall in love Toshiba's ease of maintenance, the motherboards are  spread out in the base with standard wires and subparts sold at RadioShack.

Reviews.Title: Great value!
Reviews.Author: Isaac
Reviews.Content: This is a great laptop for the price--I got mine from Best Buy and only paid 299.00 before tax during the Black Friday week!! I mostly use this for internet browsing, music, reading PDF files, and writing documents. I've had no trouble playing games or watching movies. Programs run fine. The keyboard does feel cheap but I was going to buy an ergonomic one with padding anyway. I also prefer a wireless mouse over any touch pad. I give this a five star rating because that's about as good as it gets for $300.

Reviews.Title: There is good news and bad news.
Reviews.Author: Nostromo
Reviews.Content: It's a good deal with respect to the amount of RAM and hard drive storage space you get for your dollar. The screen is also very bright and clear. However, there are several downsides.The biggest problem that I see is the sound quality, which is very poor, and it is not just the speakers, because it sounds equally bad over headphones. It is the sound card itself, which is very tinny, has no bass response, and according to the Toshiba Forum moderators, cannot be upgraded. So, don't buy this computer to listen to music. Also, the touchpad tray and clickers have a very cheap and unresponsive feel.Access to the DVD tray is troublesome, although with practice you can learn to find the eject button. The mechanism also feels very cheap and flimsy, and it has a design flaw where if you do not hold the DVD or CD very firmly while inserting it into the carriage, it can slide right into the chassis of the computer.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Laptop!
Reviews.Author: Zach Beland "ZMB"
Reviews.Content: I bought this at BestBuy for $317.99 (including tax) during the Black Friday sale. I like this laptop a lot, I use it for web browsing, watching videos/movies, and a few games. It has plenty of power and runs all the programs I use very very well! I play this game called "Rigs of Rods" a soft body car physics and the FPS is very good! The laptop looks a little cheap but feels solid, the keyboard feels good and the trackpad/touchpad is very responsive and feels quality. For the price I paid this laptop is a steal especially with the specs: Intel Pentium 2020M Processor 2.5 GHz, 6GB RAM, and a 500GB HDD.

Reviews.Title: Great deal!
Reviews.Author: Michael Ashby
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers are spot on. The speakers on this box are horrendous and to even advertise the web-cam as HD is ludicrous. Having said that, I looked very hard and could not find another laptop with Intel processor, 6 gigs of ram, 500 gig Hard Drive for anything near the $289.00 I paid for this. I have a $1,000 Dell that promised 4.5 hours of battery life and starts crying at 3 hours, This Toshiba has 17% left after 4.5 hours!.Only time will tell concerning durability but what do you want for $289.00? Well done Toshiba!

Reviews.Title: Great laptop.
Reviews.Author: Aldin Wright
Reviews.Content: This laptop is great I have no problem with it at all. I use it everyday and it doesn't get to hot or anything. Out of the box the audio is really bad but its actually not the laptop its the settings! ust go into audio settings and click "turn off all enhancements" then click "apply" (:

Reviews.Title: i hate the speakers
Reviews.Author: Aaron A.
Reviews.Content: the speakers are very poor quality but it's good laptop for the price, and the webcam isn't hd its a normal webcam

Reviews.Title: Sturdy and Reasonable but Horrific Sound Quality
Reviews.Author: sparkalatus
Reviews.Content: Ignoring the sound issue, this is a solid $300/$350 laptop. The processor is similar to an i3 and it will handle Office, Internet Browsing, HD video, and photo editing with little or no lag. The laptop itself is sturdy - not strong and high-quality - but not flimsy either. Don't expect to run just-released video games on ultra-high settings but it can handle some older games (I'd say 08 and earlier) at medium settings.My gripe with this laptop, and why I am returning it, is the sound quality. It's disgusting. I've never seen sound quality this bad in quite literally any electronic device I've ever used. It's unacceptable for any piece of modern hardware. The speakers are bad, even especially bad for laptop speakers. I'm not expecting some kind of 5.1 audiophile system either, so that in itself is not a fundamental issue. What is a fundamental issue, though, is the sound card. No matter what I listen to with the laptop, it comes out tinny and shallow. There is absolutely no depth or clarity, no matter how much I played with the equalizer. I don't mean that I just can't hear subtle bass lines. I mean that you can't properly hear deep voices in normal conversation or enjoy a song on youtube. Even watching Netflix was a struggle. I plugged my Audio-Technica ATH-M50s in and this laptop successfully made them sound worse than iPod earplugs listening to recordings of 96kbps flash video downloads. It's bad enough that it makes music impossible to enjoy. If you get this laptop you will never enjoy music on it. I promise. My $10 pay-as-you-go flip phone delivers better sound. And from what I'm reading the sound card is not replaceable, which means that regardless of what you plug into this laptop - your cheap earplugs or your $10,000 system, it will sound horrific. I would only recommend this laptop to the office jockey and the deaf. Anyone who is planning on using this laptop for music stay away.

Reviews.Title: toshiba
Reviews.Author: Reynold Haywood
Reviews.Content: Always the best in laptop cant complain works great the speed is remarkable especially with windows 8 only thing it should have had touch screen feature.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop, fast shipping
Reviews.Author: Zach
Reviews.Content: The laptop arrived quick and in perfect condition. I was surprised to find a laptop like this for such a great price. You're definitely getting your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: Rip Off
Reviews.Author: pookie
Reviews.Content: This particular seller sold a computer that only worked for 31 days. Instead of doing the right thing he hide behind the amazon refund policy. He knew that computer was not working properly. I have a main computer that I used for work and rarely used the new because the purpose of the computer was a back up if my main computer stop wroking. Please do not purchase anything from this seller because he is hishonest.

Reviews.Title: Great Bargain If You Don't Mind The Sound
Reviews.Author: JFP
Reviews.Content: I got this laptop at Best Buy for $299.00 and an outstanding Logitech wireless mouse to go with it. The M560 mouse has buttons which allow you to instantly pull up charms, tiles or your desktop, so I don't miss the fact that this laptop is not a touch screen.The computer is fast and the 6gb of memory is a great bargain--you just don't see $300 laptops with 6GB at that price. As many other people have said, the sound quality is horrible and using good speakers or headphones doesn't make a difference. If I want to watch movies or listen to music, I just route it through the HDMI connection to my flatscreen TV.Buy it, if you don't mind the horrible sound quality, it's a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Good but battery was DOA
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Good performance at  ood price. Only downside is learning Windows 8 and the battery was DOA package was on time and packed well.

Reviews.Title: charging problems
Reviews.Author: robert sloggett
Reviews.Content: had to return computer was defective upon arrival battery would not charge or retain power. returned to amazon for refund

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Southam
Reviews.Content: Only $400?  Wow, just wow!  Nice machine for the money and gave me a reason to finally learn Windows 8.

Reviews.Title: PURCHASED AS GIFT
Reviews.Author: LINDA RUSSELL BRYANT
Reviews.Content: I PURCHASED THIS FOR MY HUSBAND FOR CHRISTMAS, SO FAR, I HAVE NOT HEARD ANY COMPLAINTS SO I ASSUME HEIS HAPPY WITH IT.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba Satellite is very nice
Reviews.Author: S. Fuller
Reviews.Content: It arrived quick, within a few days and its everything I expected.  It's a wonderful laptop.  Glad I purchased it.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice
Reviews.Author: rlriddle
Reviews.Content: Windows 8 is a bit much to get used to when one is used to the Microsoft products over the years, but this CPU is seamless and fast.  The log-in screen boots up quickly and the keys are a nice size, not small like some can be.  Although this is used for everyday tasks, it is fun to personalize the screens and icons to suit the more frequent sites and applications that are used on a daily basis.  The unit runs quietly and was an overall good by.  Only drawback is that the Microsoft Office product is not included in the purchase other than a trial version, nor was the Norton Anti-Virus.

Reviews.Title: Laptop does its job and was worth the price
Reviews.Author: Brandon Jones
Reviews.Content: This laptop is a no frills laptop-but worth the money.  I'm a past Toshiba laptop user and this one has not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: really nice. fast shipping.
Reviews.Author: Esmeralda
Reviews.Content: It's really nice. very fast. The ones I saw at the store for same price they look older style and cheap.

Reviews.Title: Geat Laptop
Reviews.Author: Stacey Kennedy
Reviews.Content: Very fast. No problems at all. Would buy this laptop again in a second. Does everything I ask of it I love it!

Reviews.Title: Son Loves It!
Reviews.Author: Curt D. Pangracs
Reviews.Content: Bought it for Christmas, and my son absolutely loves it. Perfect for a High Schooler who needs a workhorse. You can't go wrong for the money.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: naomi
Reviews.Content: Windows 8 does take getting used to, so our computer techie installed the shell which is helping with the transition.  We don't know a ton about computers, and since our old one was over 5 years old with Vista, almost anything would have been better.Love the wireless keyboard and mouse and everything is running nice and fast!

Reviews.Title: toshiba satelitec55; a5302 15.6 laptop-[ntel pentium/6gb ddr3/
Reviews.Author: ada prater
Reviews.Content: igave the toshiba a five star rating because it is verry clear and it meet my expectations .ican get to what i kneed to verry fast

Reviews.Title: reasonable price, would have liked more in it
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: Battery is the only thing not happy with will not take a charge. Delivery was good and on time as described

Reviews.Title: Toshiba Laptops
Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 at the same time. These laptops were perfect for my kids. They are very lightweight and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great deal and good value
Reviews.Author: E. Kleinman "SEMwinners"
Reviews.Content: We got 2 of the same laptop. They are very very fast and I can use photoshop, excel, word, PDF, chrome browser with 30 tabs open at same time and all works like a charm. I had purchase before a custom built laptop for 1600USD and we have only eye pain and troubles with the thing, so this was super cheap and amazing value.Windows8 needed a couple of days getting used to and configuring.What we hate is that it comes pre-installed with endless apps [toshiba's and microsoft's] , games, shopping etc we do not want to waste time on and cannot get rid of these. O course this is backend for moneymaking for the companies involved, but a clutter to me and useless distraction. We should have option what to install or not. also catches up disk space. Even when we deleted some they came back with the upgrades.My girl's laptop has a dead pixel in the screen. Mine is fine.Compared to my older toshiba laptop the screen here is more tiring on my eyes, though colors are great.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: Lettie Abdelaziz
Reviews.Content: I purchased the laptop as a gift. The battery would not hold a charge, as soon as the power cord was unplugged the computer would shut down and take a half hour to be usable again once it was started back up. Disappointed that Toshiba, a manufacture that one would expect to be responsible, was not. I had to purchase a $60 battery, which, by the way, was very hard to find, my husband is in IT and after an exhaustive search found a similar battery. Replacing the battery enabled the laptop to be released from the power cord plugged into the wall to work.

Reviews.Title: horrible sound
Reviews.Author: Conor Fox
Reviews.Content: The sound is horrible. If you like to listen music on your headphones, never buy this computer.  I picked it out because it had good processor specs for the price, but apparently they cheaped out in other areas to create a holiday bestseller. I honestly have never experienced sound this tiny on any laptop.  Toshiba support claims it's working fine... oh well.

Reviews.Title: Great computer
Reviews.Author: Carlos M. Ramirez "Juan Vargas"
Reviews.Content: I really like this computer is quite and fast. The thing I don't like about it is the sound card. These problem can kind of somewhat be solve by updating windows and Toshiba. When I bought this computer I kind of hesitated because of Windows 8, now that I have had it for about 2 weeks it is great in my opinion is better than windows seven.  You get everything that windows seven has plus an app store which I like a lot.  By the way you can get the start menu in the app store for free. That is what I did not like at first because I was so just to the start menu but once I got it, was over with. This is a great computer I recommend it for any college student or regular internet surfer. Works great with Youtube, Facebook and any social media. This computer can run some games, I have played FIFA 14 and Combat Arms on it. Both games are online based, the fan tends to get a little loud when I play Combat Arms other than that it is all good.

Reviews.Title: Christmas present
Reviews.Author: puppy mom
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband as a Christmas present since his old laptop failed. Now I can use mine when I want to! :) Good price and it does everything he wants to do, although the new operating system took a little learning.

Reviews.Title: Bloated.  And defective out of the box.
Reviews.Author: Thronetogether
Reviews.Content: I've run Windows and OSX for decades, but am baffled by this greasy mess.  It was a gift for my wife to replace her 5 yr old Dell (with 1/3 the memory and hard drive space).  In theory, there's  enough RAM and HD space, but this is laptop is a cow.  The battery won't charge, but that's a small matter compared to the bloated, fluffy garbage that comes pre-loaded.  It was a marathon just resetting it to the gross factory configuration for return.  A disappointment on every level.Added 3 months later:What DIDN'T mention is that I bought TWO of these at once.  As I said, the first was defective out of the box, but the other?  The left screen-hinge broke after 90 days.  That's two for two, and I wish there was a zero rating.  Glad to hear that many are having good experiences with these, but in 20 years of computers, I've never been so disappointed with a product.

Reviews.Title: do not buy this laptop
Reviews.Author: Brian Casey
Reviews.Content: You can plug headphones into a cell phone, and get great sound quality.  You can't, with this laptop.  I have never experienced anything like it.  Tinny, monotone sound, with NO volume.  Called the manufacturer and they refused to address the issue, and told me they couldn't help me.  If you're looking to use your laptop for any kind of media, stay away from this one.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba junkyard
Reviews.Author: Bruce A. Schneider
Reviews.Content: Toshiba Laptop was the worst purchase I have made in a very long time. It came with Windows 8, which I hate. I replaced it with 7 but Geek Squd told me the keyboard was defective, as the cursor kept jumping back a space or two.I sent it to Toshiba repair, but they just reloaded windows 8 over my install and never replaced the keyboard. Sending it back again and then suing them in small claims court.

Reviews.Title: not worth a dime
Reviews.Author: hassen
Reviews.Content: It did open a simple task  if it did only half screen. so many others issues like very slow I have high speed internet

ProductInfo.Features:
Intel Pentium Processor 2020M
6GB DDR3 1600MHz memory, Intel Integrated Graphics
500GB HDD (5400rpm, Serial ATA),DVD-SuperMulti drive (+/-R double layer)
Windows 8
ProductInfo.Name: Toshiba Satellite C55-A5302 15.6" Laptop - Intel Pentium 2020M / 6GB DDR3 / 500GB / DVDRW/CD-RW / HD Webcam & Microphone / Windows 8 64-bit
